TopicTitle: Ask the Mods questions about the Forums!

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> What is forum moderation to you personally
> 

It is a hobby for me. My interest in the game itself waxes and wanes over time, but I've made a great set of friends here. 

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> How do you folks organize things with other moderators behind the scenes
> 

We have an internal chat where we discuss moderation. But mostly make stupid jokes. 

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> What are some difficult choices
> 

What to allow and what not to allow. One time I recall we discussed something for several hours before reluctantly saying we should risk letting it be posted. And not a single forum member ever commented on it. 

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> What are some of the most fun and enjoyable activities you do as a moderator?
> 

Talking to the guys. 

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> How much time in your day is taken up by moderation?
> 

30 minutes to 3 hours, depending on how busy things are.
How does moderating actually work? Do you go through the posts you want to visit or do you skim through as many posts as possible looking for rule infractions or something else entirely?

I skip around and read threads which are interesting to me or which seem likely to experience trouble, and of course we look at the posts which are reported to us. Sometimes I just click on threads I don't normally read as a random check.

> 
> 
> 17 hours ago, Rutabaga22 said:
> 
> 
> How does moderating actually work? Do you go through the posts you want to visit or do you skim through as many posts as possible looking for rule infractions or something else entirely?
> 

I do not think of myself as a forum police officer looking for some unsuspecting forum speeder to give a ticket to, if that's what you're wondering. I simply go do what I like to do on the forum. I participate in the forum games, I share my screenshots, I welcome newcomers to the forum and the game, and I do try to write my fan-fic. I also approve new member's posts, which I love doing. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Unfortunately, I do have to put on the ol' moderator's hat when I come across stuff that shouldn't be here. But it's not for the reason some people think moderators do that kind of thing. We do it because the community deserves a place that's relatively free from disrespect and disruption. We have a reputation of being accepting and accommodating. We're a giant hug-box and have community members of all backgrounds, demographics, and every other box people come in (and I really hate boxes ![:huh:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_undecided.gif ":huh:") people are people).  And when someone disrupts that harmony, we have to do what we can to fix it. It's why we rely on the goodwill of the community to report what you come across so we can take care of those things.
